author: baylego
title: Just Awesome!
review:
This is a great set! There are a lot of new pieces, and a lot of accessories.

 The minifigures are the best part! The helmets are great. The accessories are as follows: 2 binoculars, 2 rifles, 2 walkie-talkies, 1 metal detector, 1 suitcase and a stretcher. The bases look like lilly-pads.

 The jeep is very cool. There is an extra wheel attached to the back of the jeep.
It's very similar to the Indy Brickmaster jeep.

 Overall, I love this set, and wouln't hesitate to pick it up. I would actally buy two or three. 6/5!

author: Liger
title: How Could You Not Get THIS?!
review:
Actually, I must say that I think this is the only great (or good) set so far from the Toy Story theme. I'm most likely going to get two of these. 

Pros:
I could list everything out, but I'll just say everything.

Cons:
None. This isn't a con, but it would be nice if the windshield was actually a windshield, eh?

author: rich_12

review:
green green green!

great set  lots of green

author: Lost_Cosmonaut
title: Excellent set!
review:
I actually bought two of these, one for me and one for my brother-in-law who LOVES both Army Men and LEGO!

This is a GREAT set.  The little jeep is perfect, but definitely the figures are the best part.  Lots of new pieces.  The figures come with TONS of accessories, there's two rifles, two binoculars, a backpack, a suitcase and two radios.  Three plain green helmets and one marked with a Medic cross.  There's also a stretcher.  TONS of playability, the jeep is a quick build and looks good.  All in all this is a definite 5/5!

Pros:
- 4 minifigs
- Sweet color
- New pieces
- NO STICKERS
- Tons of accessories
- Neat jeep

Cons:
- Should have used clear pieces for the windshield, but this is a VERY minor con.

Keep up the good work, LEGO!

author: oldlegosback
title: It is time to built your army
review:
Love the green minfigs and the green jeep.I bought this at walmart for $10.00 and there were only a few left.I like how they did with the jeep,it's little but a cool jeep.

Pros:
the minfigs
the color
the jeep
Evening the minfig's hats

Cons:Nothing

This is a great set keep up the great work LEGO.:)

author: Jcc2224
title: Don't step on him, mom!
review: I found this in my Christmas stocking, and it was great! with 8 guns, binoculars, and walkie talkies, it was awesome!the jeep is nice with all those green elements, as for the green soldiers. The new stands for them are cool and do their trick. So remember mom, look where your going!

author: Monty
title: Life On Mars
review:
The little green men are here! You will see from my recent reviews the new Toy Story sets have appealed to me. I thought the jeep looked good even if it does only accommodate one person - we should remember the models in this series are supposed to be representing “toys” from the movies rather than the real thing. The soldiers are great representing all those toy soldiers I had as a child - I know they are still in my attic somewhere.
 
There are plenty of guns, radios, binoculars and even a stretcher allowing you to pose them a number of different ways. I like the medic with his white cross on his helmet, back pack and little case. The bases can be used with other Minifigs as they can appear as grass and will help them to stand up. Lots of mine fall over constantly if I knock the shelf they are displayed on – bases would stop this, perhaps Lego should consider using them in more sets. 

I thought this was a great fun set – it makes me smile when I look at it and the rest of the Toy Story Minifigs i have. Price could have been a couple of pounds less so I’ve knocked a point off for that.

author: Lint
title: Awesome concept, dissapointing jeep
review:
When I first heard there was to be an army men 'battle pack' I was all over it! Here's the meltdown.

PROS
Army Men minifigs are awesome. Especially the helmets and stands.
Lots of accessories
Jeep is a solid build.
Stretcher!
Green colour is great!

CONS
Duplicates/spares of the radio and binoculars. A spare rifle would have been more appreciated.
Jeep is a one seater (you can't expect too much these days)
Jeep has no facility to store any of the accessories. A couple of clamps to hold a radio and a rifle would have been very nice.
Price. It's gone up 10% compared to last years 'battle packs' and I don't think you can blame all that on licensing fees for that can you?

All in all i'm quite happy to finally have army men minifigs. I hope they do more toy story sets featuring the army men.

author: michaelvader

review:

one of the best sets ever is right here!

author: sger434
title: a good soldier never leaves a man behind
review:
this set is a funny little set. IT HAS SO MANY GREEN PIECES! (77 in total) 

Minifigs:- 
you get 4 green army men in this set (3 normal, 1 medic) they look like the actual figures you can buy but in lego. (obivously)

vehicle(s):-
the is a green jeep in this set which fits perfectly well. it can only fit 1 mii-fig in but it still good

accessories:- guns, stretcher, radios, binoc`s, metal dectector, bag and medic case all in GREEN!

overall 10/10 great

author: wildwill
title: Smaller sets = more play value
review:
Lego has really got a big hit on their hands with their "battle pack" sets.  One doesn't think "Battle Pack" and "Toy Story" in the same sentence, but this pack is the one that makes a TON of sense.  I hope they do another pack with a Crane and a bunch of little green 3 eyed men.  I also hope they do another pack of soldiers with a different little vehicle.  Hey perhaps they could even do a tan set too.

What to say that hasn't been said already...

Some have been disparaging the jeep and saying that it's too small, I think it's perfect size, you CAN put two figures on it, one sits on the back.  I think the spare tire is genius too.  I don't even mind the opaque windshield as it evokes the actual cheap army men toys it's based upon.

To reiterate the good points:

4x Green Soldiers.  
2x Bincos
2x Walkies
2x Rifles (YEAH!)
1x Briefcase - YEAH
1x Mine Detector
1x Backpack
1x Stretcher

If there is one drawback it's that Target and the Lego store at DTD Anaheim were both sold out when I tried to purchase them just after New Years.  Found one today at TRU for $11.99.  STILL worth it.

author: Niallskie
title: LET'S GO GREEN
review:
I had no plan on collecting the Toys Story Lego theme at all, but when I ran into this set at our local Target I just could not resist to buy them. Not to mention it's price being right for $10.99. When I build these soldiers, it was pure fun as I used to buy them green plastic soldiers when I was a small boy. At first I just bough one set, but was so amazed by it that I quickly ran back to grab me a couple more. Too bad these were sold out really quick. I did try to look for them on other stores but nada. I was even disappointed that the Lego Store doesn't even have them yet. I never even tried TRU coz they usually jack thing up pretty high. So on to the review.

  As always on a battle pack you usually get 4 minifigures (dont know if it's called battle pack for Toy Story theme). You get basically the same minifigure 4 times over, but I'm sure you will love it non the less. Everybody have the same everybody except for one helmet that has a white dot and a cross inside of it which symbolizes a medic. The stan are awesome, makes them look like the real plastic soldiers. Oh and this platoon si packed with armaments and what not. We have 2 binaculars, 2 riffles, 2 walkies, a mine detector, a brief case, a back pack and a streatcher. Now we move on to the jeep, yes with all the stuff that I already told you we still have a jeep in there. The jeep is awesome just to look at, its amazing how they manage to conceptualize something like this with such a small amount of bricks. Addition of black element on the jeep is a great addition but I think if they made it plain green is alright as well. The jeep is a one sitter though but still cool on its own. I guess everything in this set is practically awesome for me. I do not see any cons on this set only pros. So buying this set is a definite yes, specially if you want to build an army. I am glad I got a couple sets more at a good price. So don't hesitate and grab this set when ever you can.

author: calculater23
title: lot of mini figs for one set
review: today I went to toysrus and I was surprised to see a whole bunch of these sets. It's 15.00 canadian and comes with four mini figs. There very cool since there  green it comes with 2  binoculars a metal detector  2 rifles and 2 walky talkies.jeep is also prety cool I like the xtra tire on the back. THe helmets are sweet really i've never seen anything like it. It's quite an easy build I built in my truck on the way home.If you need some good soldiers I suggest you buy this set.

author: Hobie819
title: Awesome
review:
Awesome set...  I've been working on a lego military for awhile now and tis makes it that much easier to have an opposing army..  I had been using the Indy germans as my original army but pop normal heads and hands on these guys and they look great.

author: superdave
title: Even Better Than the Real Thing
review:
What a great set. Overall, it really captures the feeling of playing with the little green army men the set was based on. Build-wise, it comes together quickly without complications or tricky bits. The parts- beyond the obvious minifigs and accessories- are almost all green (you should not be surprised by this) and include some valuable parts in that color such as tiles and brackets.

This is a great set for parts, minifigs, and playability. If only I could get fifty soldiers in a bag for $3!

author: jonbuddy
title: "Go on without me!" - Stepped-on Green Army Guy "Never leave a soldier behind!" - Green Army Guy Sergeant
review:
This set is very good despite its size. I love the flashing on the feet of the Army Men. This set is very realistic to the actual movie, although there isn't a car in the movie.

  • The Hats
  • Gurney
  • Rifle
  • Binoculars
  • Car
  • THE WHOLE SET!

Cons

 

  • Nothing at all!

 

Overall

 

5/5

author: exo_man
title: A Great Army Builder!
review:
So I got this set a little while ago and I was surprised by how much extra gear it came with! You get almost two of everything. The minifigs are great too and the jeep is nice.Also the Minifigs can come off the stands!

Cons:

So I recomend you get this set!

author: indykid
title: Green LEGOs!
review:
I saw this set at first while looking for a board game at Target but I didn't actually get to buy it until I saw it while birthday shopping for a friend. I built it on the counter of grandparents' kitchen and it was a giant pile of green pieces!

 

Pros:

  • 4 minifigures  w/ removeable stands  (helps for driving the Jeep)
  • Jeep
  • Stretcher
  • Extra walkie talkie, rifle, and binoculars

Cons:

  • No room for stretcher and/or equipment on Jeep

Really great set! It mixes two great toys: Green Army Men and LEGOs!

author: Olamisai
title: The best lego set ever!
review:
Brilliant. A set that combines the best construction toy with the best army figure and the original animated movie, resulting in 4 perfect minifigs. For anyone over the age of.. well about 30, fond of any of the above, this is the set to get. Anyone else?.. well.. lego and army men figures!!

Funnily, what makes the set perfect are the stands. Without them you've just got some green minifigs. Add the stands, and suddenly, you're 10 years, old.. spreadeagled on a carpet.. making funny wooshbang noises and knocking over piles of small pieces of green plastic that, for reasons only known to themselves, have decided to defend a cushion.

The build.. Easy.
Capturing the feel. Absolutely. Normal minifigs have character, these minifigs have some sort of character ultra-combo!
Colours. Green.. more green, and the odd bit of (hidden) grey.

Problems.. Well. There's no tan or grey version to fight against..

Out of all my City, Technic, Space, Castle, Pirates, running back since approx 1984.. this is my favorite set and the one that reminds me why.. at the age of 37.. i'm still just a little boy.

author: rohta123
title: great for armies and lego war
review:
This is a good set.  I think it should have a better jeep fo the price i paid.   The army men are the best ive been watting for something like this for a long time.  I cutomized the troops with real hands and faces they look good(the whole green body takes a little away)

Minifigs

The minifigs are so cool.  The base plates make it so mutch easyer to set them up.  The medic is the best he has a backpack, a case and a walky-talky.  The normal troops are cool to, They have a a helmet and a variety of wepons.  All in all 9/10.

Jeep

The jeep is cool but it could have been way better.  It can fit 2 troops( you have to remove there baseplates first).  Its all green exept for 2 grey peices and a few black ones.  over all 7/10.

Pros

Minifigs

Accessories

Base plates

Cons

Jeep size

ps: Lego come out with a little green men set.

author: kaboomlegoman
title: Hut Hut Hut!
review:
This is really a cool set! The pieces are GREEN! WAKE UP PEOPLE AND LOOK! GREEN!


Minifigures: 10/10. Three GREEN army men plus a medic? Who knew that Lego would ever release such awesomeness!


Building: 610 Small set. Not much to expect here, except the car is fun.


Pieces: 10/10. Anybody who doesn't get these just for the pieces is weird.A bunch of accesories and basic pieces, and please note, in GREEN!


Playability: 6/10. They don't have anyone to fight, but march them up against you're evil anything.


Price: 6/10. Lego has been getting higher and higher with prices; I'm sure back in '06 or '07 this would've costed $10.00


Overall: 8/10. Please note that the only reason this deserves an eight is( I didn't tell you earlier) the jeep stinks. The build is fun and all, but the result is a piece of crud. The wheels jut out, it uses DKgray when it's supposed to be GREEN! (Have I mentioned that it's awesome?) and it's not in the movie. Also, the wheels barely spin. Overall, take it apart for the parts. I hate it. ( No, not the set, the jeep!)

author: brikwarsman
title: Excellent Army Builder
review:
Overall, this set is an excellent value. I picked up 9 of these on sale at Target, even though they didn't look like much in the store. When I began assembling them, however, it really sunk in that these sets were well worth the money. The minifigs, rare accessories, dozens of green parts; this set really has you covered. Its main downside is playability, though. With an absence of a tan Army Men set (which probably won't be made- this set probably slipped by Lego's strict "no-military" policy because it's a set based on another toy), this set doesn't have the playability factor of a set that includes multiple factions. This is a small disadvantage compared to the overall appeal of this set- I highly recommend this set; its value begins to shine when you get multiple copies.

 

Pros:

  • Excellent range of accessories
  • High-quality minifigures
  • Rare parts
  • Lots of Green elements
  • Fun build
  • Great army builder

Cons:

  • Lacks Enemies in Set

author: legospongepotter
title: Woo Hoo!
review:
Two words: AWESOME. SUBERB. This cute little set has four unusual minifigs - four army men preparing for battle, four army men on a dangerous mission to find the evil alien.

 

  • Pros:

*GREEN

 

Cons:

So overall, suberb and a must buy

author: Wacky_PotatoSalad
title: It's an Ok set
review:
I picked this up at Toys r Us along with Small car and traveller

This is a pretty good set.You get 4 Army men(1 who has a diffrent helmet) for 11$ You get many accesories in green for the first time like rifles and walkie talkies.I would but this set any time.But i think this set should have either came with another soldier or one of the soldiers face's could have had the same face as Agent Chase(The face without sunglasses)PROS AND CONS TIME!

author: legodude357
title: A neat little army builder pack.
review:
I am going to write a short review out of bordom and to inform customers of a good set.  To begin, I quite like all the accersorys and weapons and such. Also, this is priced very afforadbly.

 

The figures are all almost the same, except one is medic. All the little trinkets and such are interchangable throughout them all.   This is not the best set at this price point, and is far from it, but is a releif for parents. Children, even me when I was young, only liked lego sets with lots of figures. Therfore, I have huge piles of bricks from sets not wanted, and a hoarde of awesome figures. Children will go crazy at the sight of the iconic green plastic soldiers, but wait! They have an amazing jeep, with tons of weapons and objects, rare green peices, and a great army builder set! This set is still avaible at TRU. I saw it hidden at one of the displays at the front register. I only have one of this set, but it is very cool. I actually have reccomened this to a friend, and he bought it, and would thank you for reading my review.

author: z
title: 7595 Army Men on Patrol
review:
First of all, this is the only set I own from the Toy Story theme.  If this is how all of them are though, you can be sure the theme will be a hot seller.

Box:  When I first saw the box, I was not very impressed.  I thought to my self, "This was obviously meant for little kids."  The box was in no way indicative of the kind of set it contained; do not be fooled.

Instructions:  Very well layed out, nothing too much to be said here.  It is a full sized instruction book, typical of many $10-30 sets.  The building was made very easy. 

Minifigs:  Probably one of the main attractions of this set, the minifigs are quite good.  All in green, ( some time in the future they will become aliens,) they seem rare.  However,  if you look at their faces, it seems that the paint is somehow lighter then it should be.  The accessories included are two rifles, two pairs of binoculars, a back pack, two radios, a metal detector, and four all-new helmets, all in green.  Also there is a stretcher for the wounded plastic men. 

Jeep:  The jeep is a nice design, though quite simple.  There is room from one minifig, unless you have one riding on the back.  Everything is green and black.  One thing I think is odd, though it is in no way a complaint, is that the hood of the jeep is made up of two 2 x 2 smooth plates.  With the introduction to the 2 x 4 plate this year, you would have thought that Lego would have cut costs, and just slapped on a 2 x4 instead.  I am very happy about the extra wheel and tire on the back; nice detail.

Overall, I think that this is a good set and is probably one of the best $10.99 I've spent.  I hope you will consider this one.

Your humble servant,

Z 

P.S.  Lego, why the extra dollar?

author: Crt2
title: Not Bad! Except.......
review:
'Got This set about a Month ago, I Was quite Pleased when The Build was Done! Only, It Dosen't Really seem like a Toy story set. It seems More like a Action Themes Set, Know What I Mean? Aside From That, This is a Awesome set!

Pros

*It's GREEN! You do The Math!

*Awesome Figs and Tools! (I Especially Like The Green Backpack!)

*Green Faces can be used for watermelons & Other Stuff!

*Jeep is Well Designed.

Cons

*No "Toy story" Feel.

*No Enemy.

Aside from That, This is a Cheap, Sturdy, GREEN, Set! Though There is all most no Playability, This is Still A Really Good set. Buy Them While There Out!

author: Firox_5000
title: Army men
review:
I bought this fomr Argos for £9.99.

 

The set includes four army figures with boards to stand on replicating the army men in the toy story movies. the army men come with a selection of weapons and acceseries to hold and use. These include a green strecher,walkie talkie and gun.

 

The set also includes a small  green car which is a bit like a smaller version of one of the race for the stolen treasure cars. Although it never appeared in the films the car makes the set a nice addition and add's something good to the set. it certainly makes the makes the set quite more durable.

 

For £10.00 the set although not big seems to have quite a lot and is quite good value. The build takes no longer than 5 minutes and is small but quite durable.

 

I recomend this set to  everyone. Even if you dont like  toy story.

author: myater
title: Just gotta have it!
review:
I saw this on the shelf as we were picking up 7590 for my son and decided we were getting this one right then.  Just the set alone took me back to the Bucket of soldiers as a kid, but mixed with LEGO and it was a no brainer.

 

Pros: 

1. Good easy build my 5 year old was able to complete with minor help from me (wheel & tire assembly). 

2. I liked the Jeep when finished and my boy was immediatly off and playing. 

3. GREEN ARMY LEGO MEN

 

Con: They are pretty much the same size as LEGO Woody and Buzz & Jessie, so the sizing seems wrong for play.

 

So good, we got another set a week later!

author: Tupperfan
title: Not real Green Army Men!
review:
BUYERS BEWARE: These are NOT green army men. These are LEGO minifigures copying the beloved plastic toys of our childhood.

It is, however, a good starting pack to build a green-bodied army to pit against Barbie, Mr.Potato and their wicked gang. With that goal in mind, and the high attrition rate of such campaigns, it might be cheaper to buy generic plastic green army men, though.

I HIGHLY recommend buying 200 copies of this set, in order to achieve a battalion-level combat unit (with lots of medics!).

author: youngtom
title: Thought it would be better :(........
review:
I'm upset with this set.
Just like the title says.

Minifigs & Stretcher:
All minifigs are the same, except the doctor w/ the medical helmet.
One minifig has a metal detector and a gun.
Another guy has binoculars and a radio.
One more guy has a gun and binoculars.
The doctor has a backpack, a suitcase and a radio.
The stretcher is great for the City Hospital.
I give the minifigs and stretcher 4 out of 10.

Jeep:
Best part of the set.
Without the Jeep it would suck.
Its a regular Jeep and very good for a Lego City.

Pros:
The Jeep.
All the pieces are green except 7.
Cool guns!

Cons:
Everything else.

You messed up Lego.

author: NickBrick
title: " Come in mother bird, This Alpha Bravo, Come in mother bird"
review:
Sir. Your mission is play with these toys until you pass out. This is a good set. There is lots of green(obviously) There is not much to say about this exept the jeep looks very realistic and The stretcher rocks.

                                     Pros.

                                 Cons.

                                  small

author: woodall_aidan
title: Recon plan Charlie: Execute!
review: This set is the perfect set to depict Sarge and the soldiers. It comes with Sarge, the soldier who is stepped on, the medic soldier, and a regular soldier. There is also a stretcher for the wounded soldier. This isn't from the movie, but there is also a green patrol car for the soldiers to get around in. As well as everything else, each soldier comes with at least two accessories. This set gets a 5/5.

author: LobsterWarrior
title: "Move in!" -Cap'n
review:
This set has a few peak 'n pits. No straight road :P. Pieces are pretty rare & cool, but then again, not much playilability by itself. It's pretty good for those who were always going like "I want army sets!" but doesn't really match with real life combat (Not that they were aiming for that). The minifigures are epic. I love their stands and their detail. The bed-thing is awesome. Great for a MOC, if it was another color, of course. The army men are lacking a captain, and their jeep is just a tad small. Not really good if you don't have any other Toy Story sets, kinda drives you away from toy story sets. Onto the pros and cons!

Pros

-Cool jeep!

-Nice army dudes!

-Cool accessories!

-Nice new pieces! (Helmet and bed-thing)

Cons

-Not much playability.

-Drives you away from Toy Story sets.

-Lame by itself.

-Small jeep

-No captain.

 

Overall, if you have $10 to spare, but it, if not, save up for some more awesome set.

author: ToughTom
title: Grest set for minifigure fans.
review: I love this set. I looked at it a few times before picking it up with the TRU buy2get1 sale. I love the fact that you get 4 minifigures all of which have 2 things in each hand, The old gurney, and a vehicle for $11. Its a great buy. I like the idea of the army men bases too.

author: bigfootb
title: Build an army cheap and fast
review:
This set is great for minifigure collectors, toy story fans, and people who want to build a Lego army.
 
Pros
Alot of gear for the army men
Decent price
Rare pieces
 
Cons
none
 
So, as a summary, this set has a lot of playabillity and comes with alot of rare pieces. Buy it when you can.

author: btmrider
title: Good set for creating a Toy Story army
review: The Army Men set from Toy Story is a great value for the price. However, some of the pieces seem to be made of quality plastic then the rest. The printing on the minifigs themselves is also not uniform.

author: Odeinoichus
title: In the Army
review:
Set #7595 Army Men on Patrol: Months passed by, every day I saw this set, every day I was tempted, but the price continued to deter me due to budget concerns. And then, in December, near the last few days before Christmas, Wal-Mart goes and drops this down to 10$, then drops it again at 50% off, for 6.97$ each I quickly snatched up two and would have gotten three or four, but I ran out of money and the sale ended.

 

Army Men on Patrol is one of the absolute PERFECT sets that LEGO has ever created for any of their licensed Themes. It has to be the single best one out of all the Battle Pack style sets that they have ever made, why? Because it's Green Army Men, with a Green Jeep, with Green Accessories! That's why.

 

The Jeep: A charming little vehicle that can fit in anywhere, it doesn't have to stay with Toy Story alone, not in the world of LEGO. The build is staisfying and simple, it doesn't use too many parts, but they are all in green. Every last one of them, with exception to a few black pieces used to add a dash of color there, since if it was entirely in green it would admittedly be a bit bland looking.

 

The Accessories: Two green walkie talkies, two green rifles, two pairs of green binoculars, a green backpack, a green suitcase (Which I see by the new LEGO City Bank set LEGO is using to more great effect this year.) and the green stretcher. (I haven't had a LEGO stretcher since Victory Lap Raceway in the late 1980's, now I've got two of them and they're green.)

 

The Mini-Figures: Complete with LEGO Green Stands, all four of them are completely green from head to toe, with green faces, green hands, green legs, green torsos and green army hats. They look great on or off the stands, but I think on makes a little bit more sense even when put next to other Mini-Figures they should be on their stands.

 

I look at this set and I have to smile, many have stated fond memories of the little green army men they had as a youth, I have a different memory. Despite the all green Mini-Figures I am reminded of MASH the television series and spending time with my grandmother watching the show while mom and dad were working and I was getting babysat. The little jeep really reminds me of the show as does that stretcher. I think I'll call my first Doctor Hawkeye and my second Doctor Trapper, and one of the other guys can be Radar.

 

Overall I'd have to say that if you don't already have this set, get it, it has terrific green elements, a simple build, some of the greatest Mini-Figures LEGO has ever made available and it can stand to represent anything you want in your LEGO universe. Who cares if they have green heads and hands, they are still great Mini-Figures and shouldn't be criticised just because they look a little different next to normal Mini-Figures. If you have only one of this set, find a store discounting it and buy another one, everyone should have two or more of this set to show LEGO that ideas like this are what it's all about. They could give us a million and one Clones or Stormtroopers or what have you, but when they slip something like this into a Theme that is both fun and unique, I just have to compliment them on a job well done.

author: legoparent
title: We have a Code Green:  Assemble the Legos
review:
Great Set for any Toy Story fans.

 

Easy Build. Great Figures.

 

 

Cons:

Would have liked to seen more figures.  There was no army jeep in Toy Story the green army men used.  It would have been better if released similar to the StarWars Lego battlepacks.  I am not one for accessory, I want more figures.

 

Recommend It: YES

author: Jacob_Wilson
title: LEGO Disney Pixar Toy Story 7595 Army Men on Patrol - The Review
review:
Cool Army Jeep, cool Army equipment and 4 cool Army Men minifigures. This is a reallycool set, but in my whole life, I have never seen so meny green bricks in 1 set before. The car is cool because its an Army Jeep, 4 minifigures and 1 of the Army Men is the First Aid man to assit to injured Soldiers.  

Thank you for reading!

Jacob Wilson.

author: notebook5
title: Operation Green
review:
This set comes with a lot of accesories, a jeep and 4 minifigures

 

Jeep: good structure and nice simple build, but you have to take the base of the figures to sit them down in the jeep.

Accesories: lots of accesories which are all green, includes two guns, backpack, strecher, binoculars, bag, walkie talkies and a metel detector.

Minifigs: you get four minifigs in total, three the same with a green army jacket green legs a green head and a soliders helmet which is also green, the detailing on the jackets are very nice, the fourth figure is the same except he has a cross on his helmet. They all come with a green stand.

 

Overall this is a good set and i would probally buy a couple of them so you can make a little army.
